findings.title: Possibly Inaccurate Interest Accrual in CErc20
findings.description: The current implementation of autocompounding feature may result in inaccurate interest accrual due to the exposure of compoundFresh() function even for non-GLP tokens, allowing abuse to update accrualBlockNumber without collecting any interest.

findings.title: Potential Front-Running/MEV With Reduced Return
findings.description: The current conversion does not enforce meaningful slippage control during yield token swaps, potentially allowing front-running and MEV with reduced return.

findings.title: Non-VIP Withdraw Fee Bypass with JIT VIP Status
findings.description: The protocol user may flashloan the required balance right before the withdraw operation and return the same amount immediately after the operation, allowing them to bypass non-VIP fee charges.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the `Tender.fi` protocol, there is a privileged `owner` account that plays a critical role in governing and regulating system-wide operations, which poses counter-party risk to exchange users.

findings.title: Non ERC20-Compliance Of CToken/CTokenGmx
findings.description: The `CToken` contract does not fully comply with the ERC20 specification.

findings.title: Interface Inconsistency Between CErc20 And CEther
findings.description: Inconsistencies between CErc20 and CEther interfaces, such as different error handling mechanisms for functions like replayBorrow(), repayBorrowBehalf(), mint(), and liquidateBorrow().

findings.title: Deflationary
findings.description: Part of the tokens are burned or transferred as fee while on transfer()/transferFrom() calls

findings.title: Blacklistable
findings.description: The admin can blacklist any address without restriction.

findings.title: Burnable
findings.description: The new GLP Reward Router allows minting and burning of GLP, making it vulnerable to burn attacks.
